newsitem.title: USA: Sterling Software spinoff gets IRS approval.
newsitem.headline: Sterling Software spinoff gets IRS approval.

text.p: Sterling Software Inc said Monday that the Internal Revenue Service approved its spinoff to shareholders of the company's 81.6 percent interest in Sterling Commerce Inc.
If all options and warrants on Sterling Software stock are exercized, about 1.58960 shares of Sterling Commerce will be distributed for each share of Sterling Software held, the company said.
No fractional shares of Sterling Commerce will be distributed. Fractional shares will be paid in cash, the company said.
Sterling Software holders of record on September 30 will participate in the tax-free spinoff, it said.
As of September 20, about 37,853,800 shares of Sterling Software were outstanding. Options and warrants to buy another 646,400 shares were also outstanding, the company said.
Sterling Software provides software products and services for the federal government. Sterling Commerce provides software for businesses to conduct electronic communications and transactions.
